website_summaries.verdict: A compact coffee maker that works well for backpacking and comes with a cup.
pros: Works with a small butane camp stove
Brews a higher quality cup of cappuccino or espresso
Brews quickly and sets up easily
cons: Cannot be put directly on coals

customer_reviews.title: Almost...
customer_reviews.text: Fascinating how easily, even while camping, we can become civilized with a simple cappuccino or espresso... this relatively inexpensive stainless steel moka pot worked well for me on a recent two-week excursion... no, it is not the best, most precise moka pot out there. The handles are a little flimsy and the lid, difficult to open without a handle, does not fit perfectly... however, it performed very well and delivered excellent espresso! The silicone wrapping the stainless mug had a peculiar smell... a minor point since I used a different double-walled stainless mug and subjected my daughter to the mug that comes with this pot. Not perfect, but still worth the cost!
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Blizard

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a fantastic, portable coffee maker. It is as compact as described (weight and size), and makes coffee effortlessly, which is so important to me when out camping. I use it with my own collapsible stove (not the nCamp stove), and there were no issues as I expected. I really, really love the nested cup - it pretty much sealed the deal. The only real concern I have is that the handles feel flimsy and I worry how long they'll last in the long haul, but I hope that with regular care and attention I shouldn't have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: HumorousSmile

customer_reviews.title: It works well
customer_reviews.text: What a deal, this thing works, is easy to use, and most importantly it looks and feels like a pretty good quality piece of coffee gear. Only negative, the silicone on the handles, I don't believe it is silicone. Starting to melt, and I was very cautious to keep handles out of harms way. But when the plastic tool coating all melts off the handles, it won't change function, so not a concern.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: I like a good hot cup of coffee when I get ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an add on when I purchased the nCamp stove. I'm a scuba diver and I occasionally dive at quarries. I like a good hot cup of coffee when I get out of the water. I tried this and it makes good coffee. It works like a regular stove top coffee maker. Coffee was good and I like the streamlined design. Only reason I didn't give it a 5 is that it took about 10 minutes to brew on the camp stove.
customer_reviews.author: Chet Knopsnider

customer_reviews.title: Coffee tastes great!
customer_reviews.text: Keep your eye on it while it's heating up... Be sure to tighten it up enough. Listen for the steam sending the coffee to the top and enjoy a cup of great Joe! I wish it made enough for 2 cups. My main coffee maker as of now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Winner!
customer_reviews.text: I am really fussy when it comes to the flavor of coffee, it's got to be good or not at all! This little unit really gets the full flavor out of the coffee, just make sure your coffee is a medium to coarse grind. Not only use it on the trail, but also at home. I liked the engineering so much, I purchased the whole kit with stove and table - Love it! Customer service is also outstanding, it's obvious they put a lot of care and thought into their products.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: ... to use but over time it has become my favorite thing to bring on trips
customer_reviews.text: Was tricky at first to figure out how to use but over time it has become my favorite thing to bring on trips! I often chase early sunrise for photos and with this coffee maker it allows me to go and adventure while with my freshly brewed cup!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Makes excellent coffee either at home or camping. A handle on the cup would be nicer than the insulated wrap, it could fold like the handle on coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Herbert Remer

customer_reviews.title: Your personal trail cafe
customer_reviews.text: Espresso-style coffee on the go. Bought this coffee maker in conjunction with nCamp's woodburning stove. To my surprise, it fit easily on the outside of my smallest hiking backpack. I was able to hike to a lake with friends and brew coffee while we watched the sunrise, which was super cool. The coffee tastes great and heats up fast on the stove, Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Karissa Stokdal

customer_reviews.title: Compact!
customer_reviews.text: This was so compact! I loved how east it was to throw into my backpack and take it with me. It was also an easy clean up which is always a plus when in bear country. I enjoyed my coffee and it was very needed as we received an unexpected snow.
customer_reviews.author: Arden

customer_reviews.title: This thing is light and compact, makes a great cup of coffee!
customer_reviews.text: So I ordered this guy to add to my camping gear and it's completely replaced my keurig! I literally use it everyday, In fact I like it so much I just might order a few more as gifts! Just remember its going to be STRONG my first cup I didn't add water or creamer and man you can taste the coffee (which I like of course) Pour it over a large cup of ice and add some coffee mate and skip the starbucks line and save some of money too!
customer_reviews.author: Brennen

customer_reviews.title: Warning
customer_reviews.text: IMPORTANT INFORMATION SAVED FROM THE SALER !!! And everyone writing reviews :/ why this is not in the description ? See the image.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I've had this about a month and love the coffee it makes. It's a bit on the heavy for packing but would be fine for car camping.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Coffee tastes best this way
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to go along with my wood stove and it brewer the morning coffee really quickly. I really like that it has the handles on it so you don't burn yourself when its ready to go. The accompanying mug has become one of my favorites to use for all of my drinks, the rubber around it keeps your hand from getting too hot or cold depending on what is in it and allows me to wear my gloves and not have it slip out of my hands!
customer_reviews.author: Brenna

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this coffee maker. Delivers high-quality brewed coffee within minutes - and you can take it anywhere! I took it on a winter hike up Mt. Whitney and it was so awesome to have freshly brewed hot coffee with lunch. Product is lightweight and easy to work. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Wol

customer_reviews.title: Good.
customer_reviews.text: Handle weld froke after a year of use, but it still works. I've had many and this one has taken a beating, still works.
customer_reviews.author: Portland OR

customer_reviews.title: So small it tucks into anywhere
customer_reviews.text: We use this for camping and absolutely is compact and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Gindt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for solo camp trips!
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee maker. Used it on a ski trip and it was perfect for making coffee for 1. Brews great coffee, mug + pot pack into the size of a waterbottle. easy to clean the filter as well.
customer_reviews.author: brooke

customer_reviews.title: I liked it
customer_reviews.text: My better half could not get this to work, but it worked great for me. Seemed to use a lot of grounds for a serving of coffee, but tasted great.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: New Favorite Portable Coffee Maker!
customer_reviews.text: We like strong coffee mixed with condensed milk on the road and LOVED this product - nothing beats a fresh, hot cup of coffee when we camp out of our car or end a long hike. I bought this coffee maker with nCamp's stove and prep board, which I also love. Such a good traveling cooking set! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sami + Nathan N.

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: The unit came still covered with machining oil. I suggest BOILING all the parts in water before brewing your first cup.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Tiu

customer_reviews.title: Makes a mean cup of Joe
customer_reviews.text: Makes a mean cup of coffee, which is especially appreciated on cold mornings in the backcountry. I love how the cup nests on top making it easier to pack anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy D.

customer_reviews.title: Best Camping Float trip coffee pot..
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great.. We made 4 cups back to back.. give it about 5 mins in between cups.. It brews strong.. i used a medium and it was like dark coffee.. Next time i am going to buy breakfast blend and it will be medium
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little coffee syphon
customer_reviews.text: I like how they added the cup into the design of this. I'm use to carrying around pour over stuff when i'm picking or backpacking and such but this is an all in one and i don't need to carry filters anymore. Easy to use and makes a great cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Cafe Cubano at Camp!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little package that's super easy to pack. The silicone on the cup is a little inadequate at relieving heat on the hand, so be careful. Otherwise, it's awesome!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Coffee and camping go together
customer_reviews.text: Works excellent when paired with the nCamp wood burning stove (could also use a single burner) — great design. Works like a charm and perfect for backpacking, camping, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie Spontelli

customer_reviews.title: Morning Joe's necessity
customer_reviews.text: always look forward to making my fresh brew each morning in the woods. Easy to assemble and clean. very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold Fajayan

customer_reviews.title: Gourmet Coffee at camp!
customer_reviews.text: This thing makes some good coffee! The mug is awesome, and it's cool that it stacks with the cafe for easy carrying.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Difficult process
customer_reviews.text: Waited 20+ minutes for this thing to make coffee and it never worked. Very difficult to keep the fire going with only twigs as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WORTH IT !
customer_reviews.text: Everything works perfect great buy definitely recommend this coffee maker
customer_reviews.author: Jason Torre

customer_reviews.title: Ncamp mocha pot
customer_reviews.text: Make a great cup of coffee , makes about 2 cups , I cook on very low flame it brews the best on a lower flame , packs easily in backpack
customer_reviews.author: Kenny S

customer_reviews.title: Need coffee? No problem, you're welcome!
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect, nothing else to say! I'm from Italy and often have a coffee is more a vice than a need and I like very much a coffee break into the wild, in the woods or looking at the ocean... the taste is good after some use (like every coffee maker) and it's easy to clean and stock... What else to say... the quality rules on the price, if you need a coffee, this is the solution!
customer_reviews.author: Max Montella

customer_reviews.title: This was the perfect addition on our most recent family camping trip
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect addition on our most recent family camping trip. While the price point initially attracted us to this coffee maker, we were very pleased the first morning we used it. It was easy to set up, brewed in no time, and was a better cup of coffee than we brew at home! Very happy with this and look forward to my next cup!
customer_reviews.author: John
